encryption.title: Encryption / Decryption Tool
encryption.description: Encrypt or decrypt text using various algorithms with IV support
encryption.cipherModeTooltip: Cipher mode determines how blocks of data are encrypted. GCM is recommended for security (auto IV). CBC requires manual IV. ECB is least secure.
encryption.paddingTooltip: Padding fills incomplete blocks to match block size. PKCS5/PKCS7 is most common. Not required for GCM mode.
encryption.ivTooltip: Initialization Vector adds randomness. Use same IV for encryption and decryption. GCM auto-generates IV. Leave blank for auto-padding.
encryption.keySizeTooltip: Larger keys = stronger encryption. 128-bit is standard, 256-bit is maximum security. Must match between encryption and decryption.
encryption.secretKeyTooltip: The password/key used for encryption. MUST be exactly the same for both encryption and decryption. Use strong, random keys for security.

guide.title: How to Use - Quick Guide with Example
guide.exampleTitle: Example: Encrypting and Decrypting with AES-GCM
guide.pasteInput: Paste encrypted text in Decryption panel
guide.noteGCM: GCM mode: IV is auto-generated and included in output (no manual IV needed)
guide.noteCBC: CBC/CFB/OFB/CTR: You must use the same IV for encryption and decryption
guide.noteKey: Secret Key: Must match exactly between encryption and decryption
guide.noteSettings: Cipher Mode & Padding: Must be identical for both operations
guide.noteKeySize: Key Size: Must match for AES encryption/decryption
guide.recGCM: Use AES-GCM for maximum security (auto IV, authenticated encryption)
guide.recECB: Avoid ECB mode (not secure for sensitive data)
guide.recAndroid: For Android compatibility: GCM with 128-bit auth tag (default in tool)

csvToJson.title: CSV에서 JSON 변환기
csvToJson.description: 번역 CSV 파일을 중첩된 JSON, Android XML 및 iOS Strings로 변환합니다.
csvToJson.dragDrop: CSV 파일을 여기에 드래그 앤 드롭
csvToJson.csvEmpty: CSV 파일이 비어 있거나 유효하지 않습니다
csvToJson.jsonKeyNotFound: CSV에서 "JSON KEY" 열을 찾을 수 없습니다
csvToJson.successMessage: {{count}}개 행을 성공적으로 처리했습니다. {{languages}}개 언어에 대한 파일을 생성했습니다.
csvToJson.selectSheetDesc: 이 Excel 파일에는 여러 시트가 포함되어 있습니다. 가져올 시트를 선택하세요.
csvToJson.selectKeyDesc: "JSON KEY" 열을 자동으로 찾을 수 없습니다. 번역 키가 포함된 열을 선택하세요.
csvToJson.dragDropExport: 개별 번역 파일 (json, xml, strings)을 여기에 드래그 앤 드롭

sha.noteText: All hashes are automatically generated as you type. These are cryptographic hash functions used for data integrity verification.

storeValidator.usingSpecs: <0>{{name}}</0> 사양을 사용 중입니다. 이미지를 드래그하여 크기 및 파일 크기 제한을 확인하세요.

totp.secretHint: 서비스에서 제공한 키를 입력하세요 (보통 QR 코드 뒤에 숨겨져 있음).

useEffect-missing-deps.suggestion: Check if you really intend to run this only on mount. Ensure all utilized variables are in the dependency array.

naming-class.suggestion: Rename to start with an uppercase letter

no-async-use-effect.suggestion: Define an async function inside useEffect and call it immediately.

useless-fragment.suggestion: Remove the fragment or add a key if needed.

hardcoded-color.suggestion: Use a theme or constants file for colors

v-if-v-for.message: Avoid using v-if and v-for on the same element
v-if-v-for.suggestion: Move v-if to a parent element or use a computed property to filter the list

mutating-props.suggestion: Emit an event to the parent to update the value

global-scope-launch.suggestion: Use lifecycle-aware scopes like viewModelScope or lifecycleScope

print-stack-trace.suggestion: Use a logger (e.g., Timber) to handle exceptions

system-out.suggestion: Use Android Log class or Timber

thread-sleep.suggestion: Use coroutines delay() or proper async mechanisms

missing-kdoc.suggestion: Add KDoc (/** ... */) documentation for public API

nested-blocks.suggestion: Refactor code to reduce nesting (guard clauses, extract functions)

wildcard-import.suggestion: Import specific classes to avoid conflicts.

empty-list-check.suggestion: Use .isEmpty() for clarity and potential performance checks.

public-field.suggestion: Use private fields with getters and setters (encapsulation)

empty-catch.suggestion: Handle the exception or log it

static-simple-date-format.suggestion: Use a thread-local usage or java.time API (DateTimeFormatter).

print-debug.suggestion: Use OSLog or a custom logging framework

ns-object.message: Avoid inheriting from NSObject unless necessary
ns-object.suggestion: Pure Swift classes are more performant if Obj-C interoperability is not needed

force-cast.suggestion: Use conditional cast (as?) and handle nil.

dispatch-sync-main.suggestion: Use async or run on a different queue to avoid deadlocks

unowned-self.suggestion: Unowned references can crash if the object is deallocated. Use weak.

ns-log.suggestion: Use os_log for better performance and privacy

retain-cycle-blocks.suggestion: Use __weak typeof(self) weakSelf = self; inside blocks avoiding direct self reference

atomic-property.suggestion: most UI properties should be nonatomic for performance

synch-self.suggestion: Use a private internal lock object.

hardcoded-padding.suggestion: Use a constant or theme dimension for consistency

unawaited-future.suggestion: Ensure you await this or use .then()

use-arrow.message: Prefer arrow syntax for one-line functions

no-alert.suggestion: Use a proper modal or notification system

find-dom-node.suggestion: Use refs instead. findDOMNode is deprecated.

jsx-no-bind.suggestion: Use arrow functions in class properties or use functional components.

no-v-html.suggestion: Use text interpolation {{ }} or ensure content is sanitized

no-template-key.suggestion: Key should be placed on the element inside the template or the component tag itself

var-usage.suggestion: Immutability improves thread safety and reduces bugs

lateinit-usage.suggestion: Consider using nullable types or lazy initialization

run-blocking.suggestion: Use suspend functions and proper coroutine scopes.

string-equality.suggestion: Strings must be compared using .equals() in Java

notify-all.suggestion: notify() can cause lost wake-ups if multiple threads wait on same condition.

codeQuality.title: Code Quality Checker
codeQuality.description: Analyze your code for quality, security, and performance issues.
codeQuality.dropZip: Drag & drop a ZIP file here

cv.name: 이름
cv.dragDrop: 드래그 앤 드롭 또는 클릭하여 업로드

screenAudio.title: Screen Audio Studio
screenAudio.subtitle: Professional Text-to-Speech Editor
screenAudio.exportNote: Browser limitation: To download, you must share 'Tab Audio' in the popup.
screenAudio.khmerMissingText: Your system does not appear to have a Khmer text-to-speech voice installed. The audio may sound incorrect.
screenAudio.installModalNote: High-quality voices are part of your Operating System. You can install them for free in your settings.

tutorial.progSubtitle: Choose a technology to start learning
tutorial.selectTopic: Select a topic to start learning

android-basic-intro.title: Introduction to Android & Kotlin
android-basic-intro.content: Android is a mobile operating system based on a modified version of the Linux kernel and other open source software, designed primarily for touchscreen mobile devices such as smartphones and tablets. Kotlin is the recommended language for Android development.

android-basic-kotlinsyntax.title: Kotlin Syntax Basics
android-basic-kotlinsyntax.content: Kotlin is concise and null-safe by default. `val` is immutable, `var` is mutable.

android-basic-control-flow.title: Control Flow
android-basic-control-flow.content: Kotlin uses `if` as an expression and `when` as a powerful replacement for switch statements.

android-basic-collections.title: Collections
android-basic-collections.content: Kotlin distinguishes between mutable and immutable collections.

android-basic-compose-ui.title: Basic Compose UI
android-basic-compose-ui.content: Compose builds UI by nesting composable functions.

android-basic-activity.title: Activity Lifecycle
android-basic-activity.description: Understanding how activities are created, started, paused, and destroyed.
android-basic-activity.content: The Activity class provides a core set of six callbacks: onCreate(), onStart(), onResume(), onPause(), onStop(), and onDestroy().

android-basic-layouts-xml.title: Layouts (XML)
android-basic-layouts-xml.description: Building UI with LinearConstraint and ConstraintLayout.
android-basic-layouts-xml.content: XML layouts define the structure of the UI. ConstraintLayout allows you to create large and complex layouts with a flat view hierarchy.

android-xml-linear.title: LinearLayout (XML)
android-xml-linear.description: Organizing views in a single row or column.
android-xml-linear.content: LinearLayout is a view group that aligns all children in a single direction, vertically or horizontally.

android-xml-relative.title: RelativeLayout (XML)
android-xml-relative.content: RelativeLayout allows you to display children in positions relative to the parent or other siblings. (Note: ConstraintLayout is preferred for complex layouts).

android-xml-frame.title: FrameLayout (XML)
android-xml-frame.description: Blocking out an area on screen.
android-xml-frame.content: FrameLayout is designed to block out an area on the screen to display a single item. Child views are drawn in a stack.

android-xml-scroll.title: ScrollView (XML)
android-xml-scroll.content: ScrollView is a view group that allows the view hierarchy to be scrolled. It needs to have exactly one child.

android-inter-compose-basic.title: Jetpack Compose Basics
android-inter-compose-basic.content: Compose is Android’s modern toolkit for building native UI.

android-compose-layouts-standard.title: Standard Layouts (Deep Dive)
android-compose-layouts-standard.content: Understanding `verticalArrangement`, `horizontalAlignment`, and `Box` stacking is crucial for pixel-perfect UIs.

android-compose-scaffold.title: Scaffold & Slot APIs
android-compose-scaffold.content: Scaffold implements the basic material design visual layout structure. It provides slots for the most common top-level components.

android-compose-constraint.title: ConstraintLayout (Compose)
android-compose-constraint.content: ConstraintLayout in Compose works similarly to XML but with a clearer Kotlin DSL. Use it to avoid deeply nested layouts.

android-compose-surface.title: Surface & Material
android-compose-surface.content: Surface is the basic building block for Material Design. It handles elevation, shape, and background color.

android-inter-state.title: State in Compose
android-inter-state.description: Managing state with remember and mutableStateOf.
android-inter-state.content: State describes any value that can change over time. `remember` preserves state across recompositions.

android-inter-coroutines.title: Coroutines
android-inter-coroutines.content: A coroutine is a concurrency design pattern that you can use on Android to simplify code that executes asynchronously.

android-adv-hilt.title: Dependency Injection (Hilt)
android-adv-hilt.content: Hilt provides a standard way to incorporate Dagger dependency injection into an Android application.

android-adv-room.title: Room Database
android-adv-room.content: The Room persistence library provides an abstraction layer over SQLite.

ios-basic-intro.title: Introduction to iOS & Swift
ios-basic-intro.content: iOS is the operating system that powers the iPhone and iPod touch. Swift is the modern, safe, and fast programming language used to build apps for iOS.

ios-basic-swift.title: Swift Fundamentals
ios-basic-swift.content: Swift provides its own versions of all fundamental C and Objective-C types, including Int, Double, Float, Bool, and String.

ios-basic-optionals.title: Optionals
ios-basic-optionals.content: You use optionals in situations where a value may be absent.

ios-basic-control-flow.title: Control Flow
ios-basic-control-flow.content: Swift provides powerful control flow statements. `guard` is used for early exit if a condition is not met.

ios-basic-collections.title: Collections
ios-basic-collections.content: Swift provides three primary collection types, known as arrays (ordered), sets (unordered, unique), and dictionaries (key-value pairs).

ios-basic-functions.title: Functions & Closures
ios-basic-functions.content: Functions are self-contained chunks of code. Closures are self-contained blocks of functionality that can be passed around.

ios-basic-layouts.title: Layouts Deep Dive
ios-basic-layouts.content: SwiftUI layouts are built using stacks. VStack arranges views vertically, HStack horizontally, and ZStack overlays them.

ios-inter-swiftui-views.title: SwiftUI Views & Modifiers
ios-inter-swiftui-views.content: SwiftUI uses a declarative syntax so you can simply state what your user interface should do.

ios-inter-state.title: State & Binding
ios-inter-state.content: `@State` is a property wrapper type that can read and write a value managed by SwiftUI.

ios-inter-navigation.title: NavigationStack
ios-inter-navigation.content: NavigationStack is the modern way to handle push and pop navigation in SwiftUI.

ios-inter-lists.title: Lists & Grids
ios-inter-lists.content: List and LazyVGrid are used to display scrollable collections of data efficiently.

ios-adv-combine.title: Combine Framework
ios-adv-combine.content: Customize handling of asynchronous events by combining event-processing operators.

ios-adv-coredata.title: Core Data
ios-adv-coredata.content: Use Core Data to save your application’s permanent data for offline use, to cache temporary data, and to add undo functionality.

ios-adv-concurrency.title: Concurrency
ios-adv-concurrency.content: Modern Swift concurrency makes it easier to write asynchronous and parallel code.

ios-adv-animations.title: Animations
ios-adv-animations.content: SwiftUI animation is interruptible and physics-based by default.

ios-sys-camera.title: Camera (AVFoundation)
ios-sys-camera.content: AVFoundation is the framework for working with time-based audiovisual media. You can use it to create, edit, and play custom media.

ios-sys-location.title: Location (CoreLocation)
ios-sys-location.content: Core Location provides services for determining a device’s geographic location, altitude, and orientation.

ios-sys-sensors.title: Sensors (CoreMotion)
ios-sys-sensors.content: Core Motion reports motion- and environment-related data from the onboard hardware of iOS devices.

react-basic-components.title: Components & Props
react-basic-components.content: Components let you split the UI into independent, reusable pieces.

react-basic-jsx.title: JSX Syntax
react-basic-jsx.content: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript. It is recommended to use it with React to describe what the UI should look like.

react-inter-hooks-state.title: useState Hook
react-inter-hooks-state.content: `useState` is a Hook that lets you add React state to function components.

react-inter-hooks-effect.title: useEffect Hook
react-inter-hooks-effect.content: Data fetching, subscription, or manually changing the DOM are all examples of side effects.

react-adv-context.title: Context API
react-adv-context.description: Passing data deeply without props drilling.
react-adv-context.content: Context provides a way to pass data through the component tree without having to pass props down manually at every level.

react-adv-redux.title: Redux Toolkit
react-adv-redux.content: Redux is a predictable state container for JS apps.

vue-basic-template.title: Template Syntax
vue-basic-template.content: Vue.js uses an HTML-based template syntax.

vue-basic-directives.title: Directives (v-if, v-for)
vue-basic-directives.description: Special attributes with the v- prefix.
vue-basic-directives.content: Directives apply special reactive behavior to the rendered DOM.

vue-inter-composition.title: Composition API
vue-inter-composition.content: Composition API is a set of APIs that allows us to author Vue components using imported functions instead of declaring options.

vue-inter-computed.title: Computed Properties
vue-inter-computed.content: For complex logic that includes reactive data, you should use a computed property.

vue-adv-pinia.title: State Management (Pinia)
vue-adv-pinia.content: Pinia is a store library for Vue, it allows you to share a state across components/pages.

css-basic-selectors.title: Selectors & Specificity
css-basic-selectors.content: CSS selectors define the pattern to select elements to which a set of CSS rules are then applied.

css-basic-boxmodel.title: The Box Model
css-basic-boxmodel.content: All HTML elements can be considered as boxes.

css-inter-flexbox.title: Flexbox
css-inter-flexbox.content: The Flexible Box Layout Module makes it easier to design flexible responsive layout structures.

css-inter-grid.title: CSS Grid
css-inter-grid.content: CSS Grid Layout excels at dividing a page into major regions or defining the relationship in terms of size, position, and layer.

css-adv-animations.title: Animations & Transitions
css-adv-animations.content: CSS animations make it possible to animate transitions from one CSS style configuration to another.

js-basic-vars.title: Variables & Types
js-basic-vars.content: Always use `const` or `let`. Avoid `var` to prevent scope issues.

js-basic-functions.title: Functions & Arrow Functions
js-basic-functions.content: Arrow functions provide a shorter syntax.

js-inter-async.title: Async/Await & Promises
js-inter-async.content: `async` and `await` make promises easier to write.

js-inter-dom.title: DOM Manipulation
js-inter-dom.content: The DOM (Document Object Model) is an interface for changing the content of a document.

js-adv-closures.title: Closures
js-adv-closures.content: A closure is the combination of a function bundled together (enclosed) with references to its surrounding state (the lexical environment).

js-adv-event-loop.title: The Event Loop
js-adv-event-loop.content: JavaScript has a runtime model based on an event loop, which is responsible for executing the code, collecting and processing events, and executing queued sub-tasks.

html-basic-semantic.title: Semantic HTML
html-basic-semantic.description: Using the right tag for the job.
html-basic-semantic.content: Semantic elements clearly describe their meaning to both the browser and the developer (e.g., <header>, <article>, <footer>).

html-inter-forms.title: Forms & Inputs
html-inter-forms.content: HTML forms are used to collect user input.

html-adv-canvas.title: Canvas API
html-adv-canvas.content: The HTML <canvas> element is used to draw graphics, on the fly, via JavaScript.

python-basic-syntax.title: Syntax & Indentation
python-basic-syntax.content: Python uses indentation to indicate a block of code.

python-basic-lists.title: Lists & Dictionaries
python-basic-lists.content: Lists are ordered and mutable. Dictionaries are key-value pairs.

python-inter-functions.title: Functions & Modules
python-inter-functions.content: A function is a block of code which only runs when it is called.

python-inter-classes.title: Classes & Objects
python-inter-classes.content: Python is an object oriented programming language.

python-adv-decorators.title: Decorators
python-adv-decorators.content: Decorators are a very powerful and useful tool in Python since it allows programmers to modify the behaviour of a function or class.

python-adv-generators.title: Generators
python-adv-generators.content: Generators are a simple and powerful tool for creating iterators.

android-inter-navigation.title: Navigation Component
android-inter-navigation.content: The Navigation component consists of three key parts: Navigation Graph, NavHost, and NavController.

android-inter-retrofit.title: Networking (Retrofit)
android-inter-retrofit.content: Retrofit turns your HTTP API into a Java interface.

android-adv-workmanager.title: WorkManager
android-adv-workmanager.content: WorkManager is the recommended solution for persistent work that needs to be guaranteed to execute.

android-inter-lazy-layouts.title: Lazy Lists (RecyclerView)
android-inter-lazy-layouts.content: `LazyColumn` and `LazyRow` are equivalent to RecyclerView in standard Android views but with much less boilerplate.

android-inter-viewmodel.title: ViewModel
android-inter-viewmodel.content: The `ViewModel` class allows data to survive configuration changes such as screen rotations.

android-adv-flow.title: Kotlin Flow
android-adv-flow.content: In coroutines, a flow is a type that can emit multiple values sequentially, as opposed to suspend functions that return only a single value.

android-inter-side-effects.title: Side Effects (LaunchedEffect)
android-inter-side-effects.content: To call suspend functions safely from inside a composable, use the `LaunchedEffect` composable.

android-adv-animations.title: Animations
android-adv-animations.content: Compose provides high-level animation APIs like `AnimatedVisibility` and `animate*AsState`.

android-adv-datastore.title: DataStore
android-adv-datastore.content: Jetpack DataStore is a data storage solution that allows you to store key-value pairs or typed objects with Protocol Buffers.

android-inter-permissions.title: Permissions
android-inter-permissions.content: Requesting permissions at runtime is necessary for sensitive user data or features.

android-adv-notifications.title: Notifications
android-adv-notifications.content: Notifications provide short, timely information about events in your app while it is not in use.

android-adv-testing.title: Testing (Unit & UI)
android-adv-testing.content: Android testing includes unit tests (JUnit) and UI tests (Compose Test Rule / Espresso).

android-kotlin-data-sealed.title: Data & Sealed Classes
android-kotlin-data-sealed.content: `data class` automatically generates equals/hashCode/toString. `sealed class` represents restricted class hierarchies.

android-kotlin-extensions.title: Extension Functions
android-kotlin-extensions.content: Kotlin provides the ability to extend a class with new functionality without having to inherit from the class.

android-kotlin-lambdas.title: Higher-Order Functions & Lambdas
android-kotlin-lambdas.content: A higher-order function is a function that takes functions as parameters, or returns a function.

android-kotlin-generics.title: Generics
android-kotlin-generics.content: Classes and functions in Kotlin can have type parameters, just like in Java.

android-compose-modifiers.title: Modifiers Deep Dive
android-compose-modifiers.content: Modifiers allow you to decorate or augment a composable. The order of modifiers matters significantly.

android-compose-theming.title: Theming (Material3)
android-compose-theming.content: Jetpack Compose offers an implementation of Material Design 3, a comprehensive design system for creating digital interfaces.

android-compose-gestures.title: Gestures & Touch Input
android-compose-gestures.content: Compose provides a variety of APIs for handling user interactions, from high-level `clickable` to low-level `pointerInput`.

android-compose-canvas.title: Canvas Drawing
android-compose-canvas.content: The `Canvas` composable gives you precise control over rendering, allowing you to draw shapes, paths, text, and images.

android-sys-camerax.title: CameraX
android-sys-camerax.content: CameraX is a Jetpack support library, built to help you make camera app development easier.

android-sys-location.title: Location Services
android-sys-location.content: The fused location provider is a location API in Google Play services that combines different signals to provide location information.

android-sys-sensors.title: Sensors (Accelerometer)
android-sys-sensors.content: The Android platform provides several sensors that let you monitor the motion, position, and various environmental conditions.

android-sys-services.title: Background Services
android-sys-services.content: A Service is an application component that can perform long-running operations in the background. It does not provide a user interface.

android-arch-mvvm.title: MVVM Pattern (Deep Dive)
android-arch-mvvm.content: MVVM separates the UI (View) from the data and logic (ViewModel/Model). The ViewModel exposes streams of data to the View.

android-arch-clean.title: Clean Architecture
android-arch-clean.content: Clean Architecture divides the app into layers: Presentation (UI), Domain (Business Logic), and Data (Repositories/Data Sources).

android-arch-repository.title: Repository Pattern
android-arch-repository.content: Repositories abstract access to data sources (API, Database) and provide a clean API to the rest of the app.

android-arch-di.title: Dependency Injection
android-arch-di.content: DI allows you to provide dependencies to classes from outside, making testing and maintenance easier.

android-firebase-setup.title: Firebase Setup
android-firebase-setup.content: Firebase is a platform developed by Google for creating mobile and web applications. It provides authentication, database, analytics, and more.

android-firebase-firestore.title: Cloud Firestore
android-firebase-firestore.content: Firestore is a flexible, scalable NoSQL cloud database to store and sync data for client- and server-side development.

android-firebase-crashlytics.title: Crashlytics
android-firebase-crashlytics.content: Firebase Crashlytics is a lightweight, realtime crash reporter that helps you track, prioritize, and fix stability issues.

android-sec-biometric.title: Biometric Authentication
android-sec-biometric.content: BiometricPrompt API provides a standard mechanism for handling biometric authentication in a device-agnostic way.

android-sec-encrypted-prefs.title: EncryptedSharedPreferences
android-sec-encrypted-prefs.content: EncryptedSharedPreferences is a wrapper around SharedPreferences that automatically encrypts keys and values using Mainline Jetpack Security library.

android-async-channels.title: Coroutines Channels & SharedFlow
android-async-channels.content: SharedFlow is a hot flow that emits values to all consumers. Channels are used for communication between coroutines.

ios-arch-mvvm.title: MVVM Pattern
ios-arch-mvvm.content: MVVM is the standard architecture for SwiftUI. ViewModels conform to `ObservableObject` and publish changes to the View.

ios-arch-clean.title: Clean Architecture
ios-arch-clean.content: Separating your app into Presentation, Domain, and Data layers ensures scalability and testability.

ios-firebase-setup.title: Firebase Integration
ios-firebase-setup.content: Add the Firebase SDK via Swift Package Manager (SPM) to access cloud services.

ios-sec-keychain.title: Keychain & Biometrics
ios-sec-keychain.content: Use Keychain for sensitive data (tokens) and LocalAuthentication for FaceID/TouchID.

ios-inter-uikit-interop.title: UIKit Interoperability
ios-inter-uikit-interop.content: UIViewRepresentable allows you to wrap a UIKit view and use it within your SwiftUI View hierarchy.

ios-adv-testing.title: Unit Testing
ios-adv-testing.content: XCTest is the framework for writing unit tests in Swift.

react-adv-performance.title: Performance Optimization
react-adv-performance.content: Memorization helpers to prevent unnecessary re-renders.

vue-inter-router.title: Vue Router
vue-inter-router.content: Vue Router seamlessly integrates with Vue.js core to make building Single Page Applications a breeze.

vue-adv-slots.title: Slots
vue-adv-slots.content: Slots allows you to inject content into a component from a parent.

big-o.title: Big O Notation
big-o.description: Big O notation is used to describe the performance or complexity of an algorithm.
big-o.explanation:
Big O notation characterizes functions according to their growth rates: different functions with the same growth rate may be represented using the same O notation.

**Common Complexities:**
- **O(1)**: Constant time
- **O(log n)**: Logarithmic time
- **O(n)**: Linear time
- **O(n log n)**: Linearithmic time
- **O(n^2)**: Quadratic time
- **O(2^n)**: Exponential time

arrays.title: Arrays
arrays.description: A collection of items stored at contiguous memory locations.

jsonToCode.title: JSON을 코드로
jsonToCode.description: JSON에서 TypeScript, Kotlin, Swift 또는 Dart 모델 생성

unixConverter.title: Unix 타임스탬프 변환기
unixConverter.description: Unix 타임스탬프와 사람이 읽을 수 있는 날짜 간 변환.

markdownEditor.title: Markdown Editor
markdownEditor.description: Edit and Preview Markdown content with Github Flavored style.
